data.content:
noun
[noncount] sports :a period of extra play that is added when teams or players are tied at the end of normal play and that ends as soon as one team or player scores a point or gains the lead
We won 27-24 in sudden death. - often used before another noun
a sudden-death play-off in golf
medical :quick and unexpected death from any cause other than violence
a serious heart condition that can result in sudden death
